instructions.as_text:
Back:
Cast on 27 (28, 28, 30, 30) [31, 31, 31, 31] stitches with 5mm needle.
Work back and forth across these stitches while increasing the number of stitches across the
shoulders as follows:
On WS rows: kfb, p to last st, kfb
On RS rows: kfb, k to last st, kfb
Continue increasing 2 stitches per row until there are 71 (78, 86, 94, 102)[109, 117, 125, 131]
stitches on the needle. You will have knit 22 (25, 29, 32, 36)[39, 43, 47, 50] increase rows
Now work back and forth without increases for the back as follows, beginning on RS or WS row,
as appropriate:
On RS rows: sl1wyib, k to end
On WS rows: sl1wyif, p to end
Work in this pattern for 48 (50, 52, 54, 58)[60, 60, 62, 62] rows in total (= armhole depth, there are
24 (25, 26, 27, 29)[30, 30, 31, 31] slipped stitches)
Break the yarn.
Let the work rest on a stitch holder, spare cord or waste yarn.

steps.howto_summary: cast on, increases, and extending length

instructions.as_text:
Left front (left as you would wear it, see Fig. 1):
With RS facing, pick up and knit 22 (25, 29, 32, 36)[39, 43, 47, 50] stitches along the left shoulder.
Work Rows 2-8 once (all sizes) and then Rows 7-8, 0 (0, 0, 0, 0)[0, 0, 0, 1]more time
Row 2 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Row 3 (RS): sl1wyib, k to end
Row 4 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Row 5 (RS): sl1wyib, k to end
Row 6 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Row 7 (RS): sl1wyib, k to end
Row 8 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Now work increases for the neckline as follows:
Row 9 (RS): sl1wyib, m1l, k to end
Row 10 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Work Rows 9 and 10, a total of 9 (9, 9, 10, 10)[11, 11, 11, 11] times each. 31 (34, 38, 42, 46)[50,
54, 58, 60] stitches.
Break the yarn. Let the work rest on a stitch holder, spare cord or waste yarn.

components.name: right front
joins: join right front to left front, then join back and front together in the round

instructions.as_text:
Right front (right as you would wear it, see Fig. 1):
With RS facing, pick up and knit 22 (25, 29, 32, 36)[39, 43, 47, 50] stitches along the right
shoulder. Work Rows 2-8, once (all sizes) and then Rows 7-8, 0 (0, 0, 0, 0)[ 0, 0, 0, 1] more times.
Row 2 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Row 3 (RS): sl1wyib, k to end
Row 4 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Row 5 (RS): sl1wyib, k to end
Row 6 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Row 7 (RS): sl1wyib, k to end
Row 8 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Now work increases for the neckline as follows:
Row 9 (RS): sl1wyib, knit to last stitch, m1R, k1
Row 10 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Work Rows 9 and 10, a total of 9 (9, 9, 10, 10)[11, 11, 11, 11] times each. 31 (34, 38, 42, 46)[50,
54, 58, 61] stitches.
Do not break the yarn, join right front to left front as follows:
RS: sl1wyib, k30 (33, 37, 41, 45)[49, 53, 57, 60] from right front, cast on 9 (10, 10, 10, 10)[9, 9, 9,
9] using backwards-loop method, k31 (34, 38, 42, 46)[50, 54, 58, 61] from left front
Sts on needle: 71 (78, 86, 94, 102) [109, 117, 125, 131]
Next Row (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Row 1 (RS): sl1wyib, k to end
Row 2 (WS): sl1wyif, p to end
Work Rows 1 and 2, a total of 10 (11, 12, 12, 14)[14, 14, 15, 14] times each.
Armholes should now match with 24 (25, 26, 27, 28)[30, 30, 31, 31] slipped stitches for the back
and 24 (25, 26, 27, 28)[30, 30, 31, 31] slipped stitches for the front.
Join back and front together in the round as follows:
RS: sl1wyib, k70 (77, 85, 93, 101)[108, 116, 124,130] from front, 71 (78, 86, 94,102)[109, 117, 125,
131] from back.
Place stitch marker for the beginning of the round. Continue knitting all stitches in the round for
17 (18, 18, 19, 19)[19, 19, 19, 19]cm or until desired length. (Note: at this point, there remains
approx. 8 cm to knit in the body)
Work a decrease round: *k2tog, k1* around. Adjustment, if necessary: if one st remains at end of
the round, knit this st together with first st of next round and replace beginning of round marker.
If two sts remain at end of round, k2tog.
Work 2 more knit rows.
Switch to 4.5mm needle, work 1x1 rib hem as follows:
Round 1: *k1, p1* around. Adjustment: a k2tog may be necessary to even up the stitch count for
the ribbing
Work 6 cm of ribbing. Cast off using an Italian bind off.
Italian bind off tutorial link

Neckline:
Pick up and knit all of the stitches around the neckline with a 4.5mm circular needle. Knit 3 more
rounds in k1, p1 rib; including a k2tog on first round, if necessary, in order to even up the number
of stitches for the ribbing.
Cast off using an Italian bind off.

steps.howto_summary: pick up stitches and knit in the round

instructions.as_text:
Sleeves:
With 4.5mm circular needle and RS facing pick up and knit an even number - approx. 72 (74, 78,
80, 88) [90, 90, 92, 92] – of stitches around the armhole.To achieve this back up one column of
stitches from the slipped stitch selvedge and pick up 3 stitches for every 4 rows. Begin and end
at the centre of the underarm
Work in k1,p1 rib around, join in the round and knit a further 3 rounds in k1, p1 rib. Cast off using
an Italian bind off.
Repeat for other sleeve.
Finishing:
Weave in all ends; block the garment lightly and dry laying flat.

text.full_text: Lightweight and delicate short sleeve pattern with a whimsical and fluffy texture. One piece, top down construction, designed to fit loosely for an easy to wear layering top. Colourway pictured is Peony.
